Description: Cylinder seal of black steatite: perforated through the centre, bearing an incised inscription in four panels. The text has been interpreted as giving two names, although the precise rendering is uncertain. Good condition.
Curator's comments: Bibliography: P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit I (Wiesbaden, 1963), 483; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit II (Wiesbaden, 1964), 1138; P. Kaplony, 'Die Inschriften der Ägyptischen Frühzeit III (Wiesbaden, 1964), pl. 88, abb. 330.
Acquisition notes: This object, formerly numbered 4307a, was found in Cyprus in 1847 and acquired for the British Museum from the sale of H. P. Borrells's collection in 1852 (Sotheby's sale of 26 August 1852, lot 1488).
